cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 790 MI...1270 KM SSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP1 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Fernanda Advisory Number 5 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP062017 900 PM MDT Wed Jul 12 2017
...FERNANDA STRENGTHENS A LITTLE... ...ADDITIONAL INTENSIFICATION EXPECTED ON THURSDAY...
SUMMARY OF 900 PM MDT...0300 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...11.9N 113.1W ABOUT 790 MI...1270 KM SSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...45 MPH...75 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 270 DEGREES AT 9 MPH...15 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1004 MB...29.65 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 900 PM MDT (0300 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Fernanda was located near latitude 11.9 North, longitude 113.1 West. Fernanda is moving toward the west near 9 mph (15 km/h). A westward to west- southwestward motion is expected during the next couple of days.
Maximum sustained winds have increased to near 45 mph (75 km/h) with higher gusts. Additional strengthening is expected and Fernanda is forecast to become a hurricane on Friday.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 35 miles (55 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1004 mb (29.65 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 300 AM MDT.
$$ Forecaster Brown
NNNN
